profile: A passionate full stack engineer with an entrepreneurial spirit to understand business impact and the ability to lead and mentors others both technically and professionally.

skills.title: User Experience
skills.body: Bring a design background to apply user-friendly interfaces on top of all development projects.

skills.title: Development
skills.body: Architect and implement solutions using the appropriate technologies, even if it requires independent learning.

skills.title: Management
skills.body: Promote a bottom-up management style educating and empowering developers to collaborate and innovate.

positions.title: Engineering Manager
notes: Led team onboarding new engineers to standardize training while paring down technical debt.
Streamlined project management process for easier cross-team collaboration and transparency.

positions.title: Engineering Manager - Dashboard
notes: Coordinated redesign of Tumblr web product across all verticals.
Launched new video player experience including HD quality and mobile web support.
Launched multiple third party integrations as potential secondary revenue growth vehicles.
Gave internal developer talks to educate developers and promote existing tools.

positions.title: Engineering Manager - Creator Tools
notes: Shifted team focus to post & theme creation due to success on engagement growth.
Improved project transparency to technical leadership by educating team on Scrum practices.
Architected major overhaul of creation tools to modernize experience and underlying code.
Advocated new frontend architecture to standardize and improve code quality.

positions.title: Engineering Lead - Engagement
notes: Led team focused on user engagement (email, activity metrics, mentions).
Architected and built new email infrastructure; grew volume by 15x (1M to 15M) per day.
Created and tested marketing campaigns to maintain above industry standard engagement metrics.

positions.title: Product Engineer
notes: Improved legacy marketing email infrastructure to increase volume by 10x (100k to 1M) per day.
Major contributor to company-wide growth initiative including onboarding, registration & email.
Sole developer and presenter of a Google Glass application for launch partnership at Google I/O.

positions.title: Director of Backend Development
notes: Developed and maintained a network of sites that average 5 million pageviews per day.
Managed Scrum workflow for team of 10 including Frontend, Backend, and Flash developers.
Developed internal projects using new technologies (e.g., MongoDB, Scribe, nginx, Redis).
Converted video transcoding to a cloud service for improved performance and operational costs.

positions.title: Senior Developer
notes: Implemented on-the-fly packaging and minification of CSS & JS deployed via a CDN.
Migrated entire network of sites between content delivery networks with no downtime experienced.
Implemented Apple's video segmenting tools to deliver variable bit rate video streams of CollegeHumor Originals to mobile devices.

positions.title: Junior Developer
notes: Developed new content sites to grow network diversity for advertisers.
Led the switch from Prototype to jQuery to ease maintenance and cut down on page weight.
Responsible for acquiring and managing clients in need of website development.
Managed a team of freelancers to ensure projects were completed on time and within budget.
In addition to design & development, provided clients with internet marketing strategies.

positions.title: Web Developer
notes: Assigned to new high priority web-based sales channel for Prudential Insurance products.
Introduced new techniques for layout and functionality using CSS and Javascript.
Developed prototype from business requirements with anticipation of possible system limitations.
Developed frontend code allowing implementation of multiple languages and themes.
Led team transitioning prototype to application including frontend and backend development.
Ensured the code integrity maintained in transfer from prototype to application.
Managed development defects detected across multiple testing environments.

positions.title: Web Developer, ETC Web Services Department
notes: Created and maintained websites for multiple departments of RIT and other clients.
Created web-based content management systems and other web applications.
Debugged and improved existing e-commerce applications.

positions.title: Web Developer, Center for Campus Life
notes: Debugged and enhanced the Event Registration (EVR) system for public release.
Enhanced admin control panel used by Campus Life operations.
Collaborated with department heads to develop requirements for their web solution needs.

positions.title: IT Department Intern
notes: Provided technical support for the Township's employees; including software and hardware troubleshooting, operator training, and routine support.
Worked independently to gather GPS data for plotting of key Township features to improve response strategies of emergency services.

positions.title: Staff Member
notes: Responsible for entire operation of the LCC website.
Assisted in business practices such as payroll, inventory, and staffing schedules.
Responsible for the development and delivery of marketing features.
